meanings.definition: The quality or state of being prosy.
meanings.sent1: Her prosiness made it hard to stay awake during the lecture.
meanings.sent2: The prosiness of the novel made it difficult to finish.
meanings.sent3: Despite his prosiness, he managed to tell an engaging story.
meanings.sent4: The prosiness of the meeting was like listening to a broken record.
meanings.sent5: The prosiness of her voice was like a lullaby, putting everyone to sleep.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being dull or tedious in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: The prosiness of the presentation made the audience yawn.
meanings.sent2: His prosiness in conversation often led to awkward silences.
meanings.sent3: The prosiness of the manual made it seem longer than it actually was.
meanings.sent4: The prosiness of the play was like watching paint dry.
meanings.sent5: The prosiness of the speech was so unbearable that people started leaving the room.
